derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French pome grenate, from pome 'apple' + grenate 'pomegranate' (from Latin (malum) granatum ('apple) having many seeds', from granum 'seed')

entry.def: A pomegranate is a round fruit with a thick reddish skin. It contains lots of small seeds with juicy flesh around them.

means.word_mean: 1. shrub or small tree native to southwestern Asia having large red many-seeded fruit
2. large globular fruit having many seeds with juicy red pulp in a tough brownish-red rind
